briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure

detaileddescription.para: includes the opb file reader into SCIP

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
the file reader itself
full path and name of file to read, or NULL if stdin should be used
pointer to store the result of the file reading call

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, FILE *file, const char *name, SCIP_Bool transformed, SCIP_OBJSENSE objsense, SCIP_Real objscale, SCIP_Real objoffset, SCIP_VAR **vars, int nvars, int nbinvars, int nintvars, int nimplvars, int ncontvars, SCIP_VAR **fixedvars, int nfixedvars, SCIP_CONS **conss, int nconss, SCIP_Bool genericnames, SCIP_RESULT *result)
memberdef.name: SCIPwriteOpb

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
output file, or NULL if standard output should be used
problem name
TRUE iff problem is the transformed problem
objective sense
scalar applied to objective function; external objective value is extobj = objsense * objscale * (intobj + objoffset)
objective offset from bound shifting and fixing
array with active variables ordered binary, integer, implicit, continuous
number of active variables in the problem
number of binary variables
number of general integer variables
number of implicit integer variables
number of continuous variables
array with fixed variables
number of fixed and aggregated variables in the problem
array with constraints of the problem
number of constraints in the problem
should generic variable and constraint names be used
pointer to store the result of the file writing call
pseudo-Boolean file reader (opb format)

detaileddescription.para:
Stefan Heinz
Michael Winkler This file reader parses the opb format and is also used by the wbo reader for the wbo format. For a detailed description of this format see http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/PB10/format.pdf .
